channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: A judge to weigh in on SNAP benefits. And, Trump wants to resume nuclear testing
item.description: A federal judge is set to decide whether the Trump administration will have to find funds to keep SNAP benefits flowing. And, President Trump says the U.S. should resume nuclear weapons testing.
item.content:encoded:
A federal judge is set to decide whether the Trump administration will have to find funds to keep SNAP benefits flowing. And, President Trump says the U.S. should resume nuclear weapons testing.

(Image credit: Miguel J. Rodriguez Carrillo)
item.dc:creator: Brittney Melton

item.title: The Trump administration move to study aluminum in vaccines worries scientists
item.description: Aluminum has been added to certain vaccines for decades to boost their effect on the immune system, and has been shown to be safe. But, the Trump administration may be considering removing it.
item.content:encoded:
Aluminum has been added to certain vaccines for decades to boost their effect on the immune system, and has been shown to be safe. But, the Trump administration may be considering removing it.

(Image credit: Sebastian Kahnert/picture alliance)
item.dc:creator: Rob Stein

item.title: Five key takeaways from Trump's week in Asia
item.description: President Trump is back in Washington after spending a week in Asia. He attended the ASEAN summit in Kuala Lumpur, addressed U.S. troops in Japan and met with China's President Xi Jinping in South Korea.
item.content:encoded:
President Trump is back in Washington after spending a week in Asia. He attended the ASEAN summit in Kuala Lumpur, addressed U.S. troops in Japan and met with China's President Xi Jinping in South Korea.

(Image credit: Mark Schiefelbein)
item.dc:creator: Deepa Shivaram

item.title: What has 11 questions and makes you feel smart? Our news quiz!
item.description: From monsters to politics and (maybe) everything in between, it's the weekly news quiz.
item.content:encoded: From monsters to politics and (maybe) everything in between, it's the weekly news quiz.
item.dc:creator: Holly J. Morris

item.title: Shopping for ACA health plans this open enrollment? Here's what to know
item.description: This year, with Congress in a stalemate about subsidies, Affordable Care Act marketplace consumers will need to be more informed than ever to navigate their health coverage choices.
item.content:encoded:
This year, with Congress in a stalemate about subsidies, Affordable Care Act marketplace consumers will need to be more informed than ever to navigate their health coverage choices.

(Image credit: Patrick Sison)
item.dc:creator: Michelle Andrews

item.title: Automakers take a hit from tariffs, but some still see strong earnings
item.description: Automakers have been paying billions of dollars in tariffs on imported cars, parts and materials. But on earnings calls this month, some carmakers reported that they're performing well anyway.
item.content:encoded:
Automakers have been paying billions of dollars in tariffs on imported cars, parts and materials. But on earnings calls this month, some carmakers reported that they're performing well anyway.

(Image credit: Bill Pugliano)
item.dc:creator: Camila Domonoske

item.title: The American dream feels impossible for many young voters, who see no political fix
item.description: We asked readers whether young Americans today can still have a better life than their parents. They responded with stories of economic hardship and growing disillusionment with leaders in Washington.
item.content:encoded: We asked readers whether young Americans today can still have a better life than their parents. They responded with stories of economic hardship and growing disillusionment with leaders in Washington.
item.dc:creator: Elena Moore

item.title: Mother and son reflect on life 10 years after car crash
item.description: Sean Carter speaks with his mom, Jenny Carter, a decade after a car crash left him with a severe brain injury. They speak about her being his full-time caregiver and what the future holds.
item.content:encoded: Sean Carter speaks with his mom, Jenny Carter, a decade after a car crash left him with a severe brain injury. They speak about her being his full-time caregiver and what the future holds.
item.dc:creator: Max Jungreis

item.title: Trump says Senate should scrap the filibuster to end the government shutdown
item.description: President Donald Trump is calling on the Senate to scrap the filibuster, so that the Republican majority can bypass Democrats and reopen the federal government.
item.content:encoded:
President Donald Trump is calling on the Senate to scrap the filibuster, so that the Republican majority can bypass Democrats and reopen the federal government.

(Image credit: Mariam Zuhaib)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Haiti, Jamaica and Cuba pick up the pieces after Melissa's destruction
item.description: Communities across the northern Caribbean are dealing with the aftermath of Hurricane Melissa. The storm has left many without homes, power or communication.
item.content:encoded:
Communities across the northern Caribbean are dealing with the aftermath of Hurricane Melissa. The storm has left many without homes, power or communication.

(Image credit: Matias Delacroix)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press
